name: Curried Butternut Squash Soup
author: Marci Stohon
summary: This is a soup that will keep you warm during a long, cold winter!
ingredients: 1 (2 pound) butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into 1-inch pieces
¼ cup sour cream, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat
Cook and stir onion and garlic in hot butter until softened and browned, 10 to 15 minutes
Stir chicken broth, squash, curry powder, salt, cumin, and cayenne pepper into onion mixture
Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until squash is tender, about 15 minutes
Stir half-and-half and honey into squash mixture
Pour squash mixture into a blender no more than half full
Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend
Ladle soup into serving bowls and top with a dollop of sour cream
